content.description:
First climb chutes and ladders. Then follow a line of bolts to the left of the upper part of the nose. Cruxy from bolts 3-ish to 5-ish. Finish on pitch 2 anchor of the nose. Optional alien just before the end.

 A0 for grabbing 1 draw to setup 1 move.

Start left of Ruby Slippers. Basically, compression problem with left hand on corner and right hand on side pull seam. Gaining the glassy slopey "ledge" to clip the second bolt is the crux!   At the 3rd bolt or so the route eases into nice face climbing.   At next to last bolt there is a thin bit of climbing and the head crux. Finish with a "harder move than you'd like" move to the anchors.

climbs.name: Ruby Red Slippers
climbs.fa: Bob Perna, Dixie Marich, Eric Hörst

content.description: Begin on wavy rock and slanted rail up to thin seam at 4th bolt. Climb seam to anchors. Tenuous holds, thin and technical with a wild crux.
content.location: Start on grassy ledge on the green face 30' left of 'chutes and ladders'. The start is just right of Smooth Operator.

content.description: Start on small overhange below a blunt arete.   Pull initial roof (right off the ground) and cruise slab to arete. At jugs on the arete traverse left onto the left face of the arete. Follow bolts to anchors.   One may also stay on the arete and then move slightly right under the anchors to up the ante (11a -ish)
content.location: First route with overhanging start 15' left of 'Ruby Red Slippers' and just left of "nini wont stay down".

content.description: Climb bolted line between Buzzclip and Pity You.
Climb flake through 6 Bolts to anchors.
content.location: Just right of Power at Play

content.description: Start left of Rant and rave. Follow bolt to anchor. Nice balancy move at 3 bolt crux will have you pausing for thought.

Start just left of the nose. Climb to the first high bolt. Continue to third bolt and pull over the nose.   Clip 4th bolt and then up and right and clip a bolt on 'Chutes and Ladders'. From here follow bolts up and right to semi-hanging belay.    Step off the anchor to the right and move up through two bolts. Follow remaining bolts staying on left side of nose. At some point a finger crack over bulge appears on your left. Follow that to anchors.
content.protection:
10 draws if broken into 2 pitches or 18 if done in 1 long pitch. Rappel down route

 Pitch 1 : 5.9 Pitch 2 : 11.a
content.location: Just left and down hill from 'Chutes and Ladders'

content.description: Just left of Smooth operator is a line of bolts called Nini wont stay down.   Follow the first few bolts to a small roof(5.9). Then go around roof on the left on steeper slab with an insecure stance to clip the crux bolt(5.10).   Next figure out how to climb a tiny right facing seem through the crux to the next bolt(5.11). From here, climb much easier terrain to a large roof exiting right then up to the anchors.

Start on dubious rock. Move up to good rock and corner /roof. Pull around lip with thin moves to head  wall. Continue up steep wall to bolted anchors.   Staying right of last bolts is easier and scarier. Recommend moving over last bolt. A harder move, but safer.
content.location: From the start of 'Pity You' look right. There you will see a series of ramps (4th class) that lead up to a pine tree about 25' up.   The route starts on the ledge. There exists a bolt and cold shut for the belayer to anchor.

content.description: Climb very slippery face past first bolt to right facing corner stance. Continue up steeper face to anchors
Start as per Monk Gets Ripped.   At 3 or 4 th bolt. The line splits left. Follow the left split and bolts to steep wall and anchors.  There is at least 1 hold that is reinforced with epoxy.
Climb steep face with some small crimps and open handed slopers to a lip about 25' up. Pull the lip left of bolt then slabby finish to anchors.
content.location: Just right of 'Chutes and Ladders' on large grassy ledge with trees.

climbs.name: Chutes and Ladders
climbs.fa: Lisa Hörst, Eric Hörst, Bob Perna

content.description: Look for 20' bore hole/chute up face to slab. Climb slab following bolts to anchor.   Crux is at 5th bolt. Staying slightly left helps!

climbs.name: Afrosheen
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Lisa Hörst, Bob Perna

content.description: Climb right facing corner/seam. At 4th bolt look for pinch (crux) on the left side of bolt line on bulging face. Make hard moves to rail and mantle up. Continue up slab to shuts.   Harder if short.

climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Rick Thompson, Lisa Hörst

content.description: Route Name: "Drug a Virgin"Start left of Pause for thought. Basically, Follow bolts to anchor.The giant poison ivy patch was recently removed.
16 or so densely populated climbs in this area mostly ranging from 5.10 to 5.12
